alert.note: Alert for Aguila Valley; Buckeye, Avondale; Cave Creek, New River; Central La Paz; Northwest Valley; Tonopah Desert (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 3:06AM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central La Paz and Maricopa Counties through 400 AM MST... At 306 AM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Wittmann to 14 miles northwest of Tonopah to Salome. Movement was southwest at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Surprise, Buckeye, Tonopah, Wittmann, Circle City, Salome, Perryville, White Tank Mountain Park, Gladden, Vicksburg Junction, Wenden, Morristown, Vicksburg, Wintersburg, Harcuvar and Aguila. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 44 and 122. US Highway 60 between mile markers 47 and 87, and between mile markers 115 and 138. AZ Route 72 between mile markers 48 and 49. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Aguila Valley; Buckeye, Avondale; Cave Creek, New River; Central La Paz; Northwest Valley; Tonopah Desert
